titleStmt.title: John Hash to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7348

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Campbellsville Taylor County Ky
Novr 27th 1865
To his Excellency
Gov Bramlettee

Your Petitioner John Hash states that on the 9th day of September 1865 he was tried before Thos Wright a Justice of the Peace for Taylor County for a breech of the Peace in Two Cases and fined $10,, in one case and $11, in the other. He is a poor Man & has a large family, to support Wherefore he prays your honor to Remit his said fines

p.hi: Enclosed find $4 fees to J W Page assistant Secy of state

body.p: Subscribed & sworn to before me by John Hash on this Novr 27th 1865.
We the citizens of Taylor County Respectfully ask the Governor to Remit the above named fines of John Hash except fees & costs,

R P Sanders
B H Kirtley
L, C, Gunn
Thos H. Blaky
J B. McWhorter
W G, Dearen
W. W. Williams
Thomas ^his X mark^ Robinson
Thos M J Thomas

Taylor Co
Justice Ct
vs
John Hash
